title: Bear vs Standard Notes for Non-technical users
meta_description: Bear vs Standard Notes for non-technical users who want private writing without configuring encryption or extensions.
constraint_lens: You want private notes that feel safe without configuring encryption settings or choosing special note types.

verdict.summary: Bear wins for non-technical users who want private writing without security complexity. It allows locking notes with a simple device passcode or Face ID and keeps most security details out of sight. Standard Notes emphasizes encrypted editors and extension-based features that can require configuration. If encrypted note types and extension options require configuration, Standard Notes fails first.
verdict.decision_rule: If encrypted note types and extension options require configuration, Standard Notes fails first.

sections.heading: Best fit for low-stress privacy
sections.content: You want personal writing to feel safe but do not want to manage security modes. Bear offers a simple lock note option tied to your device security. Standard Notes highlights encryption, editor choices, and extension settings that can feel like something you must understand.

bullets.point: Lock note feature using device passcode or Face ID
bullets.why_it_matters: You protect a note with familiar device security without learning new encryption terms.
Most features work out of the box without selecting different editor types.
You focus on text without navigating security or extension menus.
Notes are encrypted automatically, offering strong privacy for sensitive content.
You can add rich text or task editors, though this requires enabling extensions.
Notes sync securely across devices without manual file handling.

sections.heading: Where each tool can break down

items.fails_when: You need advanced encryption controls or zero-knowledge security guarantees.
items.what_to_do_instead: Use Standard Notes if maximum encryption transparency matters.

items.fails_when: You feel unsure about enabling encrypted editors or installing extensions.
items.what_to_do_instead: Use Bear for straightforward privacy without extra configuration.

sections.heading: When this verdict might flip
sections.content: If you become comfortable with encryption concepts and want visible security guarantees, Standard Notes may feel more reassuring.

sections.heading: Quick rules
rules: If you want privacy without security menus, choose Bear.
If encryption modes look intimidating, avoid Standard Notes.
If detailed encryption control matters most, consider Standard Notes.

faqs.q: Is Bear secure enough for personal notes?
faqs.a: It supports locking notes with device security and keeps advanced security settings minimal.
Some features, such as additional editors, require enabling extensions.

faqs.q: Which feels simpler day to day?
faqs.a: Bear generally feels simpler because it shows fewer security options.
Standard Notes emphasizes end-to-end encryption and security-focused design.
